section.title: Overview
section.para: The module executes route blocks on a timer base. It can create new timer processes and execute many route blocks on same timer.
A static faked SIP message is given as parameter to called functions, so all functions available for REQUEST_ROUTE can be used.

section.title: default_interval (int)
section.para: The definition of the default interval of timers (if not present on the "timer" parameter)
The parameter can be set multiple times to get different intervals in same configuration file.

example.title: Set default_interval parameter
example.programlisting: ... # default time interval set to 300 seconds modparam("rtimer", "default_interval", 300) ...

section.title: timer (str)
section.para: The definition of a timer. The value of the parameter must have the following format:
The parameter can be set multiple times to get more timers in same configuration file.

listitem.para: mode - if set to 0, the timer will use the main (shared) timer. Any number > 0 will create the specified amount of new timer processes (which will only be handling this timer).
interval - timer interval in seconds or micro-seconds (the value must be ended in 'u'). For micro-seconds intervals, mode is set always to 1.

example.title: Set timer parameter
example.programlisting: ... # time interval set to 10 seconds modparam("rtimer", "timer", "name=ta;interval=10;mode=1;") # time interval set to 100 mili-seconds modparam("rtimer", "timer", "name=ta;interval=100000u;mode=1;") ...

section.title: exec (str)
section.para: Specify route to be executed on timer. The value of the parameter must have the following format:
The parameter can be set multiple times to get more routes executed on same timer.

listitem.para: route - the name of the route block to be executed, or the name of the function from kemi script. The kemi function receives a string parameter with the value being the name of the module.
